sense.name: a space between written characters that serves as a delimiter
sense.commentary: BLANK[+entity][+artifact][+symbol][+space][+delimiter][+character][+word/+sentence/+paragraph] Note: an empty space that functions like a character, -not- an area for writing (Sense 7)
sense.examples: Should these words be hyphenated, or have a blank between them? Each paragraph should be indented with three blanks. Imagine trying to read a text without any blanks between the words.

sense.name: a surrogate expression, utterance for a taboo word
sense.examples: As John whacked his shin he yelled, 'I hate this blank blank table!" Her brother is always saying 'the blank this' and 'the blank that'.

sense.name: an empty expanse, e.g., time, space, recollection
sense.examples: Where the two towers had stood was now a vast, glaring blank of space. Her mind is a total blank about where she might have left her keys. That period is a long blank in history, about which little is known.

sense.name: the template for an unformed or unfinished object
sense.examples: These coin blanks will be stamped as U.S. pennies. The warehouse had stacks of metal blanks that would be made into outdoor siding. This commercial paper from John's firm has an endorsement in blank. (no named payee)

sense.name: a cartridge shell that doesn't contain a bullet
sense.examples: The Hollywood stuntmen fired blanks at each other during the fight scene. These cartridges are just blanks and have no bullets inside them.

sense.name: an unmarked domino piece
sense.examples: Can you match any domino with a blank? Here is a double-six domino and here is a blank.

sense.name: small empty regions of a document
sense.commentary: BLANK[+location][+region][+small][+empty][+document] Note: an area to write in, not a space functioning as a character (Sense 1)
sense.examples: Fill in all the blanks at the bottom of this form. The exam has a multiple-choice part and a fill-in-the-blanks part. Sign your name and date in the blanks provided.
